issues.description: The solution implementation declares the attribute numberOfTutors as type short (and uses a short parameter in the constructor and setter), while the problem statement UML and task text specify numberOfTutors as an int. This creates a cross-artifact type mismatch: students reading the UML will implement numberOfTutors as an int (and tests likely expect int signatures), but the solution uses short which changes constructor and setter parameter types and the internal attribute type.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the type of numberOfTutors consistent with the problem statement UML by changing the field, constructor parameter, and setter parameter in the solution to int (or, alternatively, update the UML/specification to explicitly use short). Prefer changing the solution to use int so it matches the UML and expected student implementation: declare 'private int numberOfTutors;', use 'int' in the constructor parameter and setter signature, and adjust any code accordingly.
